VARIABLES.name: y_NY
VARIABLES.description: Whether to open New York warehouse

VARIABLES.name: y_LA
VARIABLES.description: Whether to open Los Angeles warehouse

OBJECTIVE.query: y_NY * c_NY + y_LA * c_LA + y_CH * c_CH + y_AT * c_AT + y_NY * d_1 * f_NY + y_LA * d_1 * f_LA + y_CH * d_1 * f_CH + y_AT * d_1 * f_AT + y_NY * d_2 * f_NY + y_LA * d_2 * f_LA + y_CH * d_2 * f_CH + y_AT * d_2 * f_AT + y_NY * d_3 * f_NY + y_LA * d_3 * f_LA + y_CH * d_3 * f_CH + y_AT * d_3 * f_AT
OBJECTIVE.LaTeX: \min Z = y_{NY} \cdot 400 + y_{LA} \cdot 500 + y_{CH} \cdot 300 + y_{AT} \cdot 150 + y_{NY} \cdot 80 \cdot 20 + y_{LA} \cdot 80 \cdot 48 + y_{CH} \cdot 80 \cdot 26 + y_{AT} \cdot 80 \cdot 24 + y_{NY} \cdot 70 \cdot 40 + y_{LA} \cdot 70 \cdot 15 + y_{CH} \cdot 70 \cdot 35 + y_{AT} \cdot 70 \cdot 50 + y_{NY} \cdot 40 \cdot 50 + y_{LA} \cdot 40 \cdot 26 + y_{CH} \cdot 40 \cdot 18 + y_{AT} \cdot 40 \cdot 35

CONSTRAINTS.description: If the New York warehouse is opened, then the Los Angeles warehouse must also be opened.
At most two warehouses can be opened.
Either the Atlanta or the Los Angeles warehouse must be opened.
The New York and the Atlanta warehouses cannot be opened simultaneously.
At least one of the three warehouses (New York, Los Angeles, or Chicago) must be opened.
The New York and the Chicago warehouses might be opened simultaneously.
